page.title: 19ECOLOGY OF LITTLE WITLEY
page.content: {GEOLOGY}- Keuper sandstone is general in the north-east, the rest being Keuper marl. The Little Witley fault is readily visible at NGR786639. Drainage is all easterly into the river Severn 4 km to the west. Much of the area receives its water supply from boreholes into the Bunter sandstone @ 10km north of the block. {CLIMATE}- Rainfall is about 650 mm per year and the generally mild climatee has characteristic spring droughts; snowfall is light but late frosts occur into May, strong winds are rare due to Ankerdine and associated hills within 5km south-west. Irrigation of arable crops is needed most years. {LAND-USE}- Market garden and general arable crops are grown on the lighter soils; the marl areas have more leys and permanent grass, orchard and woods, including semi-natural oak.
